title: Rajan sold his watch for Rs. 750 and got a percentage of profit equal to the cost price. What is the cost price of the watch? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let assume cost price is XLet assume percentage of profit is YSoX + (Y% of X) = 750X + (X * (Y/100) = 750Re writing equation(100X + XY) / 100 = 750100X + XY = 750*100100X + XY = 75000XY + 100X - 75000 = 0cost profit & profit percentage is same, so re writing above equationX² + 100X - 75000 = 0So X is 228.388Answer is = 228.388 Rs

Let the cp of the watch is x According to the question, the % profit is x% So the sp is =x ×(100+x)/100 rs The sp is =750 rs So, x ×(100+x)=750×100=75000 Or, x^2+100x - 75000=0 Or, x =228.388 rs (approximately) So,,the cp is = 288.388 rs
